reviews.text: This was awesome breakfast

Really nice spot and spot on service. The menu looks awesome.  We came to try the burger and did  not dissapoint!
Solid burger.
8 oz patlafrieda Black Angus meat blend of short rib, brisket chuck and shoulder
Garlic mayo
Pickles
American cheese
Crispy onions
Toasted brioche from a local baker

We also had their chilli honey wings with soy and their Octoberfest flatbread topped with beer cheese. That cheese should be on everything!

Fries werw on point and so werw rhw wings.

Definitely want to go back to try other dishes.

The Lowery Burger is the best Burger Iâ€™ve had in Queens. It is well proportioned, surprisingly uniform and the flavor is balanced well with all the toppings. The food, service, and overall vibe is fantastic. Definitely check this place out if you have a hankering for a classic cheeseburger, or anything really!
Belal was great!  The drinks were good and so was the atmosphere

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
I come here often and have tried almost everything on the menu, and it never disappoints. Tonight I had the burger with a glass of wine, and it was perfect as always. The food is consistently delicious, the service is friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is amazingâ€”cozy yet lively. Definitely one of my favorite spots!

Updated review: 9/4/25

I came back to visit The Lowery Bar & Kitchen after my first visit one year ago. I had a wonderful time. I ordered the chicken bowl which absolutely delicious. The meal was plated beautifully. Every ingredient was fresh and I truly enjoyed eating my meal. My mocktail was great as well. Special thank you to Brian who made sure that I was fine and satisfied during my visit. Thank you to The Lowery Bar & Kitchen!

I visited The Lowery Bar & Kitchen about two days ago. Kasper, the bartender was very nice and attentive. I asked for a mocktail and he created one that wasnâ€™t on the menu which was really cool.

I didnâ€™t order any food because I wasnâ€™t hungry but I did order the giant pretzel to take home.

Although, I didnâ€™t stay too long I definitely enjoyed my visit. I will definitely visit again in the near future.
Amazing spot to go too. Probably one of the best sports bars in the area. Love the local vibes.
Got a new lad at the bar makes the best drinks. I've tried most of the items on the Brunch menu, always delicious. ðŸ˜ŠðŸ‘
Quaint spot with delicious food
Always enjoy coming here. The service and community vibe are excellent. Pricing is very fair. Only gripe would be I think the brunch menu could use some freshening up. It's too breakfast heavy.

Anne is a superstar. Everything is great. Food, service, hospitality. Been here a few times and this my favorite restaurant in all of New York City and Queens. They need to expand to give the entire borough a taste.
Great and friendly service and excellent food!

I am from Chicago and was staying in LIC. Found the Lowery through a google search. Excellent service. Waiter Eli was attentive, made a lot of great recommendations and the food was prepared to my liking. I highly recommend the Steak Bowl and the Calamari. The gunpowder gin and tonics were also made to my satisfaction. The final bill was affordable. I highly recommend this place.
Fantastic local pizza place, the best in Sunnyside. Grandma's  pizza here is a real treat.

Loved this place!! Itâ€™s so cozy in and the servers were very kind. We had great cocktails and the poutine was actually very good! Closets Iâ€™ve had to a Montreal poutine!!

I would definitely recommend this place for a quiet night out in Sunnyside!
Nice place food a bite and a beer

Tried The Lowery Bar & Kitchen for the first time and was impressed. The staff were welcoming, attentive, and accommodatingâ€”especially with food allergies. Great tap selection, delicious food, and atmosphere. My dadâ€™s Pat LaFrieda burger was juicy, and my fish and chips were perfectly crisp and fresh. The manager was also actively ensuring a great experience. Highly recommend! I will definitely be going back.

Hands down the best bar/restaurant in Sunnyside! Food and drinks are delicious! Nice selection of beers, wine, and cocktails. I have loved everything I have tried, especially the burger, small plates, specials and brunch. The ambiance isâ€¦
Great small plates cozy place to meet up with friends ðŸ˜‰ great vibes
The food and drinks were delicious. It's a cute atmosphere, my friends and I loved the music. Can't wait to try it again next time I'm in NYC.

The place is cozy, small and due to the tightness it would be difficult for people with wheelchairs. Itâ€™s a lively place which we enjoyed.Food was good and was fresh and flavorful with average prices. When you order make sure you get a description of the dish. We ordered a steak flatbread and disappointed to see that it was an open faced flatbread with cheese and small tidbits of steak sprinkled over the cheese. We expected a steak instead of the tidbits. Very good service and friendly staff. Street Parking a bit difficult.

The fish & chips was awful so is attitude of the stuff of that establishment when I mentioned  my  dissatisfaction.about fiod .  The stuff gang up on me saying  we are to busy  to take your payment.  The red lipstick  puffy lips loud  mouth waitress was rudest one.

One of the best burgers in NYC! I really enjoyed the draft beers, and the desserts were lovely.
Great music taste too :D
Thanks for everything, you have an amazing team that makes your place even more welcoming!
Amazing food experience! Best burger place I have been in NYC so far
La nourriture est dÃ©licieuse, le service irrÃ©prochable. Vraiment une trÃ¨s bonne expÃ©rience je recommande vivement !

Great spot to hang out, grab a bite, and enjoy a good beer.
The food and the welcome are perfect too! Highly recommended!

Drinks were really good but food was not. We ordered the ny strip steak, which is the most expensive dish in the menu. Steak was fatty and had no flavor, fries were stale, salad was just a tiny amount of arugula. Moscow mule was really good and refreshing. Service was fast. Ambiance was nice. I might go back for drinks.

Move in went phenomenal! Alexis was a tremendous help she helped every step of the way. I love my apartment home! She communicated well the entire process couldnâ€™t have picked a better place to call home love my new apartment home! Took her time and my apartment was everything I wanted
The Irish breakfast spot in and filling. Wonderful staff. Bar tender pours an as close as you can get Guinness
Great neighbourhood bar and restaurant.
Great bar good food

I am literally sitting here while waiting for an early dinner that started just as drinks and apps and the experience has been nothing short of perfection.  The service, food and drinks have been amazing. Itâ€™s our second time here only because we live over an hour north of here. Definitely a place you have to patronize you will not be disappointed.

Must try spot in sunnyside. The food is amazing and has a big variety of dishes. I recommend the New York strip, it was cooked to perfection and is up there with the best steak I have ever had. The staff are all so friendly and welcoming.

Perfect neighbourhood spot with welcoming staff and delicious foods !

Warm on a extremely cold evening.

Must try wings
Salmon and NY Strip with peppercorn sauce.

Dont forgot The brownie and mint chocolate chip ice cream !
Had lunch at the weekend and honestly the best meal Iâ€™ve had in ages.  Party of 5 who all had different meals and everyone really liked the food.  Great pint of Guinness as well.  Highly recommend
Really nice staff and well priced lunch

Get the burger! Hands down the highlight of the meal. Pat Lafrieda blend, perfect. Good service. Lost a point because the goat cheese/caramelized onion flatbread was not great. Has so much more potential if it didn't have chunky tomato sauce on it. Goat cheese and onion feels more like it should be a white flatbread maybe with some balsamic glaze drizzle. I wasn't expecting red sauce.

The food is pretty amazing and very good quality. Just don't expect a custom menu, it's set and they won't adjust anything. We had pancakes, breakfast tacos and salad.

Not sure if we just got a server who wasn't interested or having a bad day but, sadly we felt it.

Final note, don't get the steak. It's hardly seasoned and it came out cold for us. Tip to chef: generous salt & pepper with a light oil glaze will make the steak taste better.

My absolute favorite place in Sunnyside! Me and my husband; we have been going to the Lowery since they opened in the neighborhood and they never disappointed! Their food is delicious and you can easily realize that it is made with love and care. We tried lunch, dinner, brunch, everything. Owner, Anne, Staff, all of them are very friendly and always so attentive and caring. We love you !
Warm and inviting atmosphere, 10/10 food. Would 100% recommend!

Visited a brisk Friday afternoon.  Walked in though I'm not from Sunnyside I felt at home.   Warm greeting even with one person holding down the fort at the time.

Now the food and drinks.  Both great, the Moscow mule was not gingery but tasty, tart, enjoyed it. Chicken sandwich was served in a sort of toasted slice bread.  Not my preference but I actually still enjoyed it.  Having eaten it sliced made it more manageable to eat then other places lol.

No complaints, great service, great food, will be going back.

P.s.  Nice touch, having a curtain block the front door from that nasty cold draft of air during the winter.

Food was delicious. I'll say all the dishes!
Nice atmosphere, cozy.
Good service.
Parking is easy too. Municipal parking under the subway until 10pm. only one block away.

Wowwwww  Belal the server was amazing !!! the food was phenomenal..I highly recommend the burger and beef stew . .he was super attentive and the environment plays 70- 80s music, very chill ....well return
Outstanding restaurant/bar. Great vibe. Awesome service.

I loved this place before. We came here a couple time, until the lady with the blonde hair she is a host i guess, told to me to sit back to my place (we were about to head out) and she thinks i cannot be any close to my friend. While we were spending our last second at the place. Ridiculous jealous woman, have a life before you tell people they need to sit 1 meter from each other. Ruined my last moment at the place thanks... You should work at mcdonalds then not at a pub, you are the server you serving me at a place like that. Remember that... Shame...
Excellent food and service

Phenomenal dinner! The service was amazing, the staff was friendly and attentive. All of the food was absolutely delicious (beef bourguignon and mash was especially good). The ambiance and space itself was cozy and lovely!

Went here with a friend for lunch - turns out they have brunch menu everyday!

PROS - friendly and competent staff, we were seated promptly, menu was accurate, items were in stock.  The wait staff was efficient and attentive but not intrusive. The poached eggs were absolutely perfectly cooked. The breakfast platters were amply sized.

Cons: the pork sausage was lackluster and hard and kind of spongy. Not a fan. The sound needs attention - they could use sound dampening canvases or something as the voices really bounce off the walls, tables and floors creating a bit of a cacophony as more folks come in to eat. I would say for those of us with noise sensitive make sure you bring your noise blocking headphones so you can hear the folks at your own table.

5 stars as the only bad things are my personal preferences - the quality and atmosphere are great

Bonus - this is a pub/tavern type atmosphere and does not smell like stale old beer seeped into the floor. Unlike many taverns and pubs this one smells good
Great burgers and wings!
The food and service are always incredible. Everything is always so delicious but the Roast Beef Sandwich is Incredible.

My comfort restaurant >_<
One of the best restaurants in Sunnyside.
The vibe is very cozy. They have outdoor and indoor dining. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. The food was very tasty and reasonably priced. My usual meal is Beef Bourguignon. But the other dishes are very good too!!
For dessert I love Churros and Vanilla Ice cream.

10 out of 10 Always Good!!

Great elevator pub situated in cozy Sunnyside Queens offering huge selection of craft beers, cocktails and impeccable grub. Happy hour Monday through Friday and the staff is so friendly. Lively with mature crowd.

Parking is a bit difficult due to residential streets nearby, but definitely worth the trip.

Amazing cocktails and food. The cocktails are strong and delicious. The food is great. I had the burger and the sauce that goes with it is perfect. The wings are crispy. I came in here randomly and can't wait to go back. Even the waiter is friendly and service is quick. 5 stars.

Love this place! It is the go-to brunch spot for me and my boyfriend, and weâ€™ve taken family and friends here as well. Perfect portions, delicious food and drinks, and friendly staff. Indoor and outdoor seating available, and despite theirâ€¦

The Lowery is hands down our favorite local restaurant and a staple of Sunnyside. Since the first time we dined there, we were made to feel not like customers but friends and that starts from the amazing owner Anne and trickles down to every single wonderful person that works there. Special shout out to Brian and Jane who go out of their way to make our six year old son feel special every single time they see him. And the food? So delicious! We are regulars so we've basically tried everything and they're all delicious. The pork bao buns and the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich are particular favorites! And my son's "regular" is the chicken tender and fries! You can't go wrong going to the Lowery. Literally a drink or dish made for everyone. Run don't walk - you won't regret it!!

The atmosphere of the bar is so homey and warm and the staff bring it all together. If you are blessed to have the waitress I had, Jane, she was very sweet and always checking up on us! I try to come in here at least once every two weeks to check out the specials menu that always surprises me with new delicious items as I try not to stick to my ultimate favorite the fried chicken sandwich. I genuinely do not think you can get a better fried chicken sandwich in queens!!!

The Benedict, Poached Eggs with steak on top of the fluffiest biscuits youâ€™ve ever had was immaculate. The French toast was too die for. My friend tried the Lowery breakfast and didnâ€™t share so that should give you an idea of how good it was!!!!!!

Early March my and wife and I held a baby shower there. They were extremely accommodating with us and our guest. They also were very friendly and it worked out very well. We had families and most of the ladies at the tables and we had filled the bar with our drinkers and younger crowd.

Music was good/ food was good / service was great! Anne was such a great manager worked hand in hand with our coordinator to make that day such a great experience.

Overall 10/10 would highly recommend your next event there.

We ordered a beef burger (delicious and juicy), a chicken sandwich that was super spicy, and the potatoes. Fries were super crunchy too. For dessert we ordered some chirros with ice cream.. I forgot to take a photo of the food but I managed the dessert hahaha

The atmosphere is super cozy!
The burger was fantastic, comes w crispy onions and pickles, they also cooked it perfectly-i ordered medium.
Fish and chips were great too.
We will be back

Had a wonderful experience at The Lowery. The Bartender Kasper made me a Whiskey Sour after I requested a sour type of drink. I ate the fish and chips and it was very good. The fish was delicious and crispy and paired well with the tartar sauce. The fries were delicious as well. Highly recommend this place as the atmosphere was nice and the food was delicious. I will be coming back in the future!
I come here once a week and the food and service are always excellent. The fish and chips are easily the finest I've had.

Such a fun and relaxed atmosphere the staff are so attentive and friendly, I felt like a regular after my first time here! Now I am a regular ! The Brunch Burger is my go to - Best pint of Guinness in Queens!

Overcast, rainy, and cool temperatures on this Sunday evening in NYC.  Searched for a Bar/Pub/Eatery in the Sunnyside area, in hopes of finding a place with good food, service, and prices!

And, we certainly found the perfect combination - in every way possible! We were greeted by a staff member - in a very friendly and warm way - and were immediately seated, as there was no wait for a party of 2.

Our waitress (Jane) came over after a few minutes, and she was truly the shining jewel of our experience! Jane was friendly, warm, and genuinely nice - and helped us with questions we had about food and drinks.  She recommended their burger (which was simply PERFECT) - did I mention PERFECT - and made our first dining experience at Lowery, a very memorable one (in the most positive way possible).

The burger was juicy and flavorful, and smothered in cheese (which is an add on) a garlic mayo, crispy onions, and pickles.  Absolute burger heaven.  Fries were EXCELLENT! Drinks were perfect too - and above all the service and attentiveness of Jane was TRULY AMAZING!

A beautiful dining experience overall - and I look forward to going again, very soon!

CHEERS!!! ðŸŒ¼ðŸŒ¼

I've been wanting to try this place for a while so my expectations were pretty high, but honestly this is just middle of the road for me, especially considering how pricey it is. Their happy hour $2 off draft beers is pretty misleading since it only applies to two beers, Stella and something else. The brussel sprouts were delicious but super overpriced, for something you can easily make at home. Fish and chips were good, and appropriately served with malt vinegar. Veggie burger was okay, though I'm not a fan of burgers that get super mushy in the middle and the beet spread that came with it sounded better than it actually was, and took away from the burger. Going with some roasted beets on the side would probably be a better move and keep everything from getting extra soggy too. Honestly wouldn't come back, the outdoor seating out front is also plagued with little flies that aren't shy and will end up all over your food and floating in your drinks. Really more of a two star restaurant for me but our waiter was great and they make a good margarita so at least there's that.
Met up with some high school friends here. Our friend brought her 6 month old and he fit in well. The food was delicious. The staff were friendly and accommodating.

One of my favorite burgers in New York and I love that Iâ€™m only a couple of blocks away.
Veggie burger is just as delicious, also try the calamari or any of the seafood dishes, always fresh. Another favorite of mine, only on special menu, is the steak sandwich with pesto.

Staff and owner are the best! Attentive, funny and just great people to spend some time with.

Love my local!
Delicious brunch with very nice outdoor seating options. The eggs Benedict on biscuits were so perfect. The staff was so nice too!

I visited here yesterday, and I was taking pics for bar view and decorations, cause Iâ€™m doing blogger things and I was planning to post about this restaurant on my blog. Bt, a guest who is familiar with bartender asked me coldly â€˜What areâ€¦

Staff was very friendly, great vibe. I got the chicken wings and watermelon burrata, and the burrata is what knocked it down to 4 stars. It just wasnâ€™t anything great and for $20 thatâ€™s kinda of disappointing. Some of the pieces ofâ€¦

This location is cozy and relatively quiet on a Friday night at 12am. The food is available until 1am but only from the late night menu which still has a decent selection. We ordered the short rib brisket blend burger with a side a friesâ€¦

Omg... love this place. They have a unique twist on bar favorites like wings. OMG!! First time eating those type of wings. 2 second time in this bar. Absolutely love it. Great place to whine down. Finished up my work and enjoyed great food with awesome atmosphere.

This place is amazing! Our server, I don't know his name, was attentive and great. He was a new server and had been there a couple weeks.

My family and I ordered drinks and sliders and flatbread. The food was amazing - and so were the drinks.

I loved the atmosphere and the energy here. It was a really cozy spot and even though there were some people there it wasn't too crowded or too loud.

I loved it here: the service, the food, the environment were all enjoyable and wonderful.

I would definitely come back here for dinner or a drink. This was a great spot - and it was convenient to get to.

I went during the restaurant week, I had never been there before and wanted to try it out with a few friends who are cooks. At first there was no one for about 5 minutes  to greet us while it was only busy at the bar. Once we sat down we enjoyed  the appetizers until it was the time for the entree. Once they took our appetizer plates, not even a minute later we received our entrees. Which   they probably have been cooked and ready for a while and been sitting there. We ordered  2 salmon which was an extra 10 dollars  and a burger.
The salmon dish was supposed  to have fingerling potatoes, instead came with zucchini.  There  was a lemon puree which  was in the bottom. It was the strongest  sour disgusting sauce I ever had. It made the whole plate awful. So we asked for a separate dish and ate only the salmon. I would have paid 20$ not 35$ for just the salmon. I was so happy that no of the sauce  touched it. Then was dessert which was good. In all I wouldn't  eat that dish ever again.

This place is great the service was perfect! After many months we had our first night out and we really enjoyed. Thanks to all the servers working so hard and with the mask on! The burgers were on point!
